author: Special Correspondent
text:
Venkaiah Naidu to meet party leaders and cadre

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), Puducherry unit, will conduct a meeting on Monday to chalk out its strategy to face the Assembly polls which are around the corner in the Union Territory.

Union Urban Development Minister and Senior BJP leader M. Venkaiah Naidu who will be visiting the city, is likely to discuss BJP’s action plan for the coming Assembly polls with party leaders and cadre on Monday.

BJP’s local unit president V. Swaminathan said the action plan for the party for the coming Assembly polls would be discussed at the meeting in which cadre and leaders of State, district and constituency level units would participate. This will be Mr. Naidu’s first visit to Puducherry after becoming a Union Minister.

In an alliance with BJP, the ruling AINRC fielded its candidate R. Radhakrishnan in Lok Sabha polls and won with a huge margin. Immediately after Lok Sabha Election, Mr. Visweswaran was made nominated member of the Legislative Assembly.

This will be

Mr. Naidu’s first visit to Puducherry after becoming a Union Minister
title: BJP meet to chalk out election strategy tomorrow
